page.title: 13SAWYER'S FARM LITTLE CORNARD
page.content: Sawyer's Farm has 5 acres of land. The oldest part of it has been there since 1320 and they had wings built on the house in the 16th Century. They have been growing herbs for 10 years and wild flowers for 4 years and they grow vegetables. The owners of the farm are Mr and Mrs Stevens. One of the rarest wildflowers is Corncockle. Everything is done by hand. They grow plants in polytunnels as they are cheaper than glasstunnels. They called it Sawyer's Farm because there might have been a saw-pit there. The herbs they grow are to sell and they send herbs and flowers around the country. They are growing the flowers next to the motorways because all of the wild flowers are dying.
